result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Walter David Zweck

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Walter David Zweck appeared by video.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Walter David Zweck.  Prosecuting attorney Kylan Reilly in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present due to a personal matter.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Walter David Zweck not in court.  Attorney Haley E Wentz appeared by video for Walter David Zweck.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr Zweck is currently in the hospital. Imposed and stayed bench warrant will continue. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant not in court. Attorney Haley E Wentz in court by video. Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness was present. Case adjourned due to Attorney Haley E Wentz advising that the defendant did not appear due to being hospitalized. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Court imposed but stayed a Bench Warrant until the next date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Walter David Zweck in court with Attorney Haley E Wentz; both appear by video.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present due to personal reasons. Defense objects to an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Walter David Zweck in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Patrick O'Keefe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 6-23-2022 @2p
